dataIdInfo.idAbs:
Calculate Valley Confinement along a stream network using segmented polygons. This tool also generates a confinement by centerline output.

Please specify a scratch GDB and disable M and Z values in the Geoprocessing Environments before running this tool.

tool.name: ConfinementTool

param.name: InputFCCenterline
param.dialogReference:
Stream Centerline segmented as desired for calculating confinement.

Segments do not need to be split at every junction, but all confluences should connect to the line network. For example, a tributary junction does not need to split the main stem, but the tibutary feature must start from this junction.

param.name: outputConCenterlineFC
param.displayname: Output Line Network Confinement Feature Class
param.dialogReference: Specify output feature class (in a File Geodatabase) to store the Confinement by Centerline output.

param.name: outputConSegmentsFC
param.displayname: Output Confinement by Segments Feature Class
param.dialogReference: Specify output feature class (in a File Geodatabase) to store the Confinement by Segments output.

param.name: InputTempWorkspace
param.dialogReference: Specify a scratch File GeoDatabase to store temporary data.

param.name: CrossSectionLength
param.dialogReference:
Maximum Cross Section Length to use when splitting up the channel polygon segments. Should be slightly larger than the expected cross section of the channel at its greatest width, but also account for areas where the line network is at an angle to the banks.

Too large of a cross section will split up the channel in other locations, too short of a cross section will not split the channel in wide sections.

tool.usage: Please specify a scratch GDB and disable M and Z values in the Geoprocessing Environments before running this tool.
tool.summary:
Calculate Valley Confinement along a stream network using segmented polygons. This tool also generates a confinement by centerline output.

Please specify a scratch GDB and disable M and Z values in the Geoprocessing Environments before running this tool.
